clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: For nutritional supplementation and for treating dietary shortage or imbalance

contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Alpha Linolenic Acid ALA is an 18 carbon polyunsaturated fatty acid with three double bonds It is also called an omega 3 fatty acid and is essential for all mammals Alpha linolenic acid or omega 3 fatty acid intake can decrease the risk of cardiovascular diseases by 1 preventing arrhythmias that can lead to sudden cardiac death 2 decreasing the risk of thrombosis blood clot formation that can lead to heart attack or stroke 3 decreasing serum triglyceride levels 4 slowing the growth of atherosclerotic plaque 5 improving vascular endothelial function 6 lowering blood pressure slightly and 7 decreasing inflammation ALA deficiencies can lead to visual problems and sensory neuropathy Scaly and hemorrhagic skin or scalp inflammations may also develop

incompatibilities.description: alpha Linolenic acid may increase the antiplatelet activities of Ibrutinib
